messages.content: Hi Kevin, this is Fred from the Microsoft customer service team. Thank you for reaching out. May I know your name, please?
I'm Kevin. I'm a bit confused about Windows, honestly.
Thank you for that, Kevin. I’m here to help. What specifically are you confused about regarding Windows? Is it the installation, features, or something else?
I just got a new computer with Windows 11, and I'm not sure how to use some of the features. It's overwhelming.
I totally understand, Kevin. Windows 11 introduces a lot of new features. Would you like an overview of the main features, or do you have specific functionalities in mind that you're struggling with?
I guess an overview would be fine, but it just seems like everything has changed.

Sure thing, Kevin. Windows 11 has a new Start Menu, improved taskbar, and virtual desktops, among other features. For instance, the Start Menu is now centered and showcases your most-used apps. Does that help at all, or is there a particular feature that still seems confusing?
A little bit, but I still don't get how to access some of my old apps. They don't seem to be where I expect them.
I see, Kevin. Sometimes older apps might not appear automatically in the new menu. You can try typing the app’s name in the search bar on the taskbar. Would you like me to guide you through that?
Yes, please. That would help a lot. I just want to get this figured out.
